intro: Pogonopus exsertus, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
